answers.answer: That's odd BC at 17 weeks baby should weigh around 5oz.. so that's not that much bigger at all... i dont understand why they are saying you're baby is so big? What do they think is wrong?

He isn't really sure what's going on I've been on meds for the past 4 months for Utis or bladder infections no matter what I drank or what I did I had one now I'm having this terrible pain an he is just saying the baby is huge already measuring at a 28 an shouldn't be this early plus I previously have two high risk births

Sorry I was 14 weeks I had to look at my papers, I have also developed baby brain lol where I can't remember nothing anymore! When I went back for my 17 weeks he was almost 12 oz by the monitor but idk how much that's true they told me my girls where going to be 9lb babies an came out barely weighing 6 lbs but I can def tell u I look. Like I'm about to pop!
That's really strange.. I'm not sure what that could mean.. maybe diabetes? Good luck though... I wish I could say more about it..

Well I go in two weeks for the diabetes test so idk I myself have only gained 20lvs which is good considering my other two kids I gained 100 an did not have the diabetes with them I'm just  worried a. Little the last two days I couldn't walk with out help to the bathroom because it felt like my insides where going to fall out an I was in horrible pain

question: This is my third child! I'm 24 weeks when I was 17weeks we had my ultrasound done the baby was at 6 oz the lady said it was a little big went into the dr today an my stomach is measuring at 28 inches the dr had to do a double take bc he could not believe it! He said he is hopin that the baby is just really stretched out but when I come back in4 weeks that he really hopes I'm not measuring at that again! Well upon arrival to the dr I couldn't hardly stand straight up I'm hurting bad in my middle section an pelvic area, they dr seen an told me to go on bed rest till I come back! I'm really scared bc I've also been havin mild contractions about 6 today! Idk do u think it could be SPD?
title: Bedrest an pelvic pain
